glsa.title: Xpdf, Poppler: Heap overflow
glsa.synopsis: Xpdf and Poppler are vulnerable to a heap overflow that may be exploited to execute arbitrary code.

background.p: Xpdf is a PDF file viewer that runs under the X Window System. Poppler is a PDF rendering library based on the Xpdf 3.0 code base.

description.p: Dirk Mueller has reported a vulnerability in Xpdf. It is caused by a missing boundary check in the splash rasterizer engine when handling PDF splash images with overly large dimensions.

impact.p: By sending a specially crafted PDF file to a victim, an attacker could cause an overflow, potentially resulting in the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
